title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Kia ora, congratulations choosing use R programming language Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau (Auckland Council)!

what: Wait, why should I learn R?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: ’s great question! ’re probably familiar using Excel working data. Excel powerful versatile tool access , ’m guessing ’re see limitations software: Things can go wrong easily: simple mouse click can change important data; stray keyboard entry can erase crucial formula cell B16, without value need cell AB16 won’t show. Nobody wants . can’t reproduce things: work put preparing beautiful table year’s data? ’ll need lot copying, pasting, tweaking get working next year’s data. Plus: understand everything cells work. keeps crashing: spreadsheets get bigger bigger, start adding pivot tables charts kinds things ’s going take load thing onto screen, run risk losing everything crashes ’re making important changes changes things unexpected ways: pasted dates Excel thinks number, numbers thinks dates. Sometimes, trying helpful, Excel making life harder. feel pain. feels like ’re fighting tool, feels like ’s taken long need, ’re right place.

title: Simplify the Process of Writing R Code at Auckland Council
text: basic example shows install load useful R packages (known collectively tidyverse), securely store retrieve path team’s locally-sync’d SharePoint Document Library.
code: library(awhina) get_started("tidyverse") #> ℹ You already have these packages installed. Ka rawe! #> Warning: package 'tidyverse' was built under R version 4.2.1 #> ── Attaching packages #> ─────────────────────────────────────── #> tidyverse 1.3.2 ── #> ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6     ✔ purrr   0.3.4 #> ✔ tibble  3.1.7     ✔ dplyr   1.0.9 #> ✔ tidyr   1.2.0     ✔ stringr 1.4.0 #> ✔ readr   2.1.2     ✔ forcats 0.5.1 #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag() #> ℹ All packages installed and loaded. Happy coding!

code: create_environment_variable("MY_SHAREPOINT_FILES") #> Paste the path to your locally-synchronised SharePoint directory:  #> ℹ Successfully created the .Renviron file to store your directory path. file.remove(".Renviron") #> Warning: cannot remove file '.Renviron', reason 'No such file or directory' #> [1] FALSE

title: Retrieve the full path to the local SharePoint directory where your team's files are stored — get_file_storage_path
code: get_file_storage_path() #> ! You do not have a .Renviron file. #> ! Please call create_environment_variable('MY_SHAREPOINT_FILES') and pass the path to your SharePoint directory when prompted.

title: Load packages — get_started
text: Given list package names, append purrr package list check installed (install ). Afterwards, load packages via library().

title: Load packages — get_started
code: get_started(c("dplyr", "lubridate")) #> ℹ You already have these packages installed. Ka rawe! #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union #>  #> Attaching package: ‘lubridate’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     date, intersect, setdiff, union #> ℹ All packages installed and loaded. Happy coding!
